misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No detected notional-machine misconception (logic matches spec)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that sorting the scores array requires swapping the corresponding names at the same time to keep the parallel arrays aligned, and that after an ascending sort the maximum score will be at the last index.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected here: this is an accurate model of how parallel arrays must be maintained during swaps and how ascending ordering places the largest element at the end.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output for valid inputs (N>0 and exactly N names and N scores provided).

misconceptions.inferred_category_name: Unchecked edge case: zero students leads to invalid index
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they can always take the top student as index N-1 after sorting, without considering that N might be 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: In Java, arrays of length 0 have no valid indices; computing indexOfTopStudent = -1 and accessing studentNames[-1] / studentScores[-1] throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. The program needs an explicit guard for N==0 (or require N>=1).
